website_summaries.verdict: A great, affordable option for small batch frying.
pros: The lid, heating element, and oil tank are removable for easy cleaning
View window allows you to monitor cooking
You can lift the basket and drain while the lid is closed
cons: The temperatures are printed on the dial, which can wear off over time

customer_reviews.title: Cannot fry wet battered food
customer_reviews.text: I bought fryer to mainly use for fresh seafood, I used a wet batter and the instructions specified that the food not be placed in the basket until the basket is submerged in the oil, I did this and everything stuck to the basket and the food had to be scraped off from the basket, this happened twice. It appears that this unit is for frying frozen food only and should not be considered for anything else. I would not recommend this appliance to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: For me, this Hamilton Beach deep fryer was a nightmare. Upon first use, it leaked most of the oil all over my counter from the bottom of the fryer. The cheap plastic lid wouldn't even close all the way so heat was lost, which of course, is counterproductive for a deep fryer. Sending back ASAP and going back to my first love, even though it's more $, the DeLonghi Cool Touch-now that's a quality deep fryer!! See ya, Hamilton Beach!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lanismom

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely excellent. I have no idea if I'll ever fry ...
customer_reviews.text: Two words: onion rings. Yup. That's why this was purchased. Thin slice onions, soak in buttermilk for at least an hour. Dredge in flour and plop into the fryer, filled with canola oil. Absolutely excellent. I have no idea if I'll ever fry anything else since I don't eat a lot of fried food. But onion rings? Can you ever have too many super crispy onion rings? And it was on sale for 1/2 price? Yeah, baby.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Mmmmm, fries, cheese sticks, chicken strips
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while to heat up, but the mozzarella cheese sticks, french fries, crispy chicken strips all taste great. A few of the larger french fries take longer to cook. You have to watch the mozzarella cheese sticks...if they stay in too long they will loose all their cheese, but cooked at the recommended time they turn out fine.....but if you see that first bubble of cheese....pull them out, they are done!
customer_reviews.author: From the mind of Bob

customer_reviews.title: Won't get hot enough.
customer_reviews.text: I got it home and put oil in it, set to 375. When the light came on I checked the temp with a thermometer and it was only at 300. Closed the lid and waiting 10 more minutes, still only 300. Had read another review about this problem before buying and am now sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Super fryer for single or couple.  Easy to use, easy to clean and delivers delicious, healthy tried foods!  YUM!
customer_reviews.text: Great little fryer! Almost impossible to get splashed oil. Heats fast and cooks great with crispy foods and very little oil soaking in. One key is the right oil. Frying needs to be done at 375°. So you need an oil that will not smoke and burn (and be harmful). I am using EXTRA LIGHT Olive Oil (NOT Extra Virgin). It's smoke temp is about 450°, so you can cook safely at 375° and oil will stay healthy and use many times. It is a perfect size cooked for 1-2 people, too small for families. If you are single or just a couple like we are, it's great. Happy Cooking (and eating)!!! Tim
customer_reviews.author: Tim Lumsden

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with my new fryer!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected! super easy to set up & use... pretty simple clean-up & doesn't take up too much counter space like most fryers that are bulky and ridiculous...perfect little at-home fryer fort all our frying needs... I would definitely recommend this appliance to a friend/family member.
customer_reviews.author: Erika GustafsonTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: easiest unit for cleaning and frying
customer_reviews.text: most little deep fryers, are a real pain to clean. this units tub , element, basket and cord, all disassemble for cleaning. Its so easy to use , as it has an indicator light when oil is at the setting you chose to cook. The tub , basket , ect. all go into the dishwasher for cleaning, and the cords safety feature is unique, as its magnetic. The size is perfect for cooking shrimp to French fries for the family. Best unit I have found, and believe me I shopped around.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but what was I thinking??
customer_reviews.text: It's been a few weeks and this thing is pretty awesome, I love to cook but usually I only cook healthy food and I have never had or used a fryer before. Initially I thought I would use it only on occasion but when I received it I used it almost every day for a week...YIKES! Bad idea to buy during the time of year I need to look best in a bikini! Lol. I don't have anything to compare this to but it seems decent, easy to use and a great price. Get it! Especially if you love jalapeño poppers like me :D
customer_reviews.author: Danika Lee

customer_reviews.title: Poor Cooking Space to Oil Ratio
customer_reviews.text: The interior basket size is less than the oil space - meaning, you need a lot of oil in order to bring it to the level needed to fry, but the amount of food you put in it is restricted by the basket size compared to the external cavity size. I can fry the same amount of French Fry in my 4 Cup Japanese tempura fryer pot using 2-1/2 to 3 Cup of oils, but this needs at least 5 to 6 cups of oil to bring up to the depth to 'fry'. And French Fries came out horrible... must be my cooking technique. I like it that there no oil splatter though.
customer_reviews.author: Polly Bee

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought in July. Died today. Ridiculous! $50 for three months of use. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: ILMOM

customer_reviews.title: Good price for an oil fryer
customer_reviews.text: It is worth the value. You shouldn't expect a fancy sophisticated fryer for this value paid. I just couldn't give it 5 stars because : 1. The electric wire is TOOOO SHORT! I have to push the fryer to the electric outlet. 2. While frying, when i open the lid, it drops oil on the side of the fryer. I have to keep paper towel around the fryer and beneath to avoid any mess or any water/oil getting in contact with electricity (especially that the device should stay too close to the outlet)
customer_reviews.author: Nora Almani

customer_reviews.title: Overall may give good performance, but made with cheap parts prone to break
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to try out this fryer given many good reviews online and features we found appealing. However, when we received the fryer and put it together to our dismay we realized the lid would not close because the closing mechanism was broken. The closing mechanism relies on a tiny, fragile piece of plastic to latch onto, and it had snapped off in the box at some point, so we had to return the whole thing. Comparing it to our old fryer, which was also a budget-friendly model, it's inexcusably cheaply made. We'll be trying a different product instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Like the other reviews said
customer_reviews.text: Like the other reviews said, this appliance is really easy to setup, breakdown and clean. The other nice feature is that you can close the lid before dropping food into oil to prevent splattering. It makes great fried foods (when your diet allows). The packaged frozen foods do really well. Making fresh cut fries is a bit more complicated(see recipes) which is no fault of the fryer. I do wish it came with and extra basket. Also made fried twinkies and fried Oreos which were just decadently sweet.
customer_reviews.author: GTH

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a losing proposition for easy and safe cooking
customer_reviews.text: 1. does not clean up easily 2. temperature dial wears off after only several uses - I don't know what I am setting the temperature at! 3. the plug plops off very easily necessitating reaching over a hot fryer to re-attach 4. the interior pan is virtually impossible to read what is minimum or maximum oil levels.
customer_reviews.author: QJC

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use!
customer_reviews.text: First use fine, but oil only came up about 2" over the basket. (Full amount of oil) don't know if it would be enough to fry a chicken breast? Second use the heating element didn't work. Of course, it was too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: kris-tina a.wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to use. Only drawback is that makes it so easy to fry pickles, fries, wings, whatever ... you will add the pounds quickly and have to purchase a new wardrobe. Not kidding. Will probably end up taking 5 years off your life, too. Not recommended for the health-conscious or anyone on a paleo diet.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Great for small meals
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I have used for multiple food items and works great. Easy to clean and heats up quickly. The only draw back which is clearly stated in the description is the size. Very small. If you are cooking for 2 people then it is great but if you have more than 2 then you will be making multiple drops and at 10 mins on average per cooking cycle it adds up.
customer_reviews.author: S. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This fryer is pretty terrible. It gets the job done for pre packaged foods but it does not reach the max temp of 375, so things are never crispy. It also leaks oil all over my counter EVERY SINGLE time. Very annoying. Also, the power cord is bad, you need close access to an outlet or you will need an extension cord, and you have to move the entire unit to unplug because it’s plugged into the back of the fryer. I would not recommend or buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Cait

customer_reviews.title: AWESOMENESS
customer_reviews.text: only used once so have not yet cleaned and can't review it. It appears it will be easy to clean and it is easy to use. The safety feature 3 star is because while it is touted as being cool to the touch it is not cool to the touch. So, too pay more for this feature - don't bother, otherwise buy buy buy
customer_reviews.author: C. Southwell

customer_reviews.title: Simple Durable Fryer
customer_reviews.text: The fryer is compact, takes up little counter space and fits a reasonable amount of food inside the frying basket. It seems a very durable construction, easy to disassemble and clean, plus it's design is simple. The sale price I paid for this fryer was certainly worth it, if you enjoy fried food every now and then and wish to have a tool that makes cooking easier I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ok for 1 or 2 people  small basket
customer_reviews.text: this not bad fryer not enough space to deep fry anything of any size maybe you get 2-3 severing of fries sm serving - temp gage is hard to read & even when light says its achieved the desired temp , it runs about 25* lower than dial , except of put it on high then it get the oil smoking the basket doesn't seat right when you lower in oil & generally have to play with it for minute to get it to were you can close the lid & you still have to basically dis assemble it to clean it , but it clean up easily & very light weight
customer_reviews.author: Wm Ratcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Super Nice Fryer!
customer_reviews.text: We always used a fry daddy...after years of use it was harder to clean properly so decided to get a new fryer. We really like this fryer, seems to keep that deep fried smell down, it was so easy to clean up, and the food fried up very nicely! I like the fact that you cannot get burned as well with the plastic all around the heat source to protect you from burns. We are very satisfied with our purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Lid window is useless
customer_reviews.text: I used this first to do chicken wings - the time it took to get the correct internal temp was a bit longer than the instruction book stated. The window on the lid - pretty much useless. As soon as you put something in the fryer & close the lid, it steams over and you can not use it to check on your food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Test thé product before putting it in the market
customer_reviews.text: Not working at all,try too many outlet still not working,call amazon,hooked me with Hamilton beach dept,waited hit more than 20 minutes no one came ,it happened twice ,I will never buy anything from amazon from a third party sellers,lost my money
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Delphin

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Took me a few years to finaly get one, but I'm so glad that I chose this particular Hamilton Beach to be my first deep fryer. I love this thing! Our first meal were shrimp, talapia, scallops and french fries cooked to perfection. The second meal were pork chops that produced the same results. Both came out golden brown using the Kirkland brand canola oil. Love the fast heat up time and indicator lights and the handy wire basket. The basket held 2 5oz talapia, 8 colossal shrimp, and 8 large scallops at the same time and cooked all of them thoroughly. Clean up was a breeze. I highly recommend this deep fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Nate M.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this deep fryer! Great fryer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This deep fryer is amazing! I bought it as a gift for my boyfriend for Christmas and it works wonderfully!! Cooks everything we could ever need. Good for 2 people. If you're cooking for 4, it will take a couple loads. Heats up fairly quick, cooks to perfection, easy to assemble, heat, and turn off. Chord is short and can come detached easily for safety precautions which I appreciate, so make sure you have maybe a "forever" spot to keep it so you won't have to move it around often. We love this deep fryer and would recommend to anymore. Great fryer for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Best Deep Fryer Period
customer_reviews.text: We love this deep fryer. We moved, and threw away our hold one of this model. They didn't have this in stock at Walmart, so we purchased another brand and regretted it immediately. I found this model online and bought it, and we through the other one away. I love that you can control the temperature, and everything comes out perfectly cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Stricker

customer_reviews.title: Recieved a product that looked like it was previously used! Gross!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought the product in May and recieved it on time. Finally it is July and I open the product and it looks like some had used it and repackaged the product? Everything was oily and the inside even looks rusted and like there is some build up. There was not even a plug to use to see if the product worked. We are very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie Bordonada

customer_reviews.title: Heats quickly, cool exterior and cleans easy!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this! Have larger fryer for home, got this for travel trailer and used it several times on recent camping trip. Easy to store, use and clean. Because space is an issue in RV, it is important that the sides stay cool so no one gets burned, and I stored it in a plastic bin with the container of new oil. Was easy to pour grease into strainer to clean it after use. Highly recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: G'ma

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far!
customer_reviews.text: We are happy with this little fryer so far. We've only been using it for a month; maybe a total of five times. It is easy to use, to set up, and to clean. We've made homemade fries and chicken nuggets, apple fritters, and frozen tator tots and corn dogs. The only complaint is that when we put the frozen tots in, the "ready" light immediately turned off because the temperature went down. That is to be expected though. We learned to let it continue to heat up for a few more minutes after the "ready" light goes off if we are doing something frozen.
customer_reviews.author: SATM

customer_reviews.title: Nice gadget for frying small batches
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use, reasonably priced deep fryer. I use it outside, set on a stable and heat-resistant surface. I do wish I had bought a slightly bigger fryer, as the frying basket does not hold much. And only a few inches of the frying basket will actually get submerged in the oil, relative to the amount of oil you need to pour in the trough. Even though it is plastic, it withstands heat well.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Leano

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for home fryer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, heats up quick, works great. I had a double fry daddy before and it just left a lot to be desired. This fryer is not that much more in cost compared to a fry daddy and yet it is so much better and has so many features that make it superior. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Melchizedek108

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Portions!
customer_reviews.text: Great for French fries and small portions, and works good for a family of 3. I do wish I had of bought the larger one now for when having guests, but it is a good product so far and cooks great as long as you don't overfill it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fryer for a month and I've used it probably 15-20 times. It is perfect. The size is great for snacks or cooking for two. So far everything I have fried has come out perfectly golden brown using the instructions in the manual so I would say the temperature control is spot on. It's very easy to clean and for what it does it takes up minimal space on the counter. I'm a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a decent fryer that is not too small, but not too bulky either, then this is it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas present for my husband and I don’t think I could have done a better job picking one out for him. The price was great for the quality of the fryer. It holds more that what I assumed it would! We’ve only had it a month but we have used it at least 6 times. We have learned that if you can put it in a wonton and fry it, it’s going to be good! Hahaha! If you are looking for a decent fryer that is not too small, but not too bulky either, then this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Sonia M

customer_reviews.title: The sides do heat up
customer_reviews.text: The sides do heat up but not too badly. I received it today, washed it and used it for fries. It works great, the lid stays closed until you open it. Fries dripped off most of the remaining oil after just a few minutes of draining. I'm loving it! I trust Hamilton Beach products so I was expecting a great appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Lilli's Books

customer_reviews.title: Great little fryer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take camping. You're not supposed to use an extension cord with this item so you need to put it on a table real close to where you're going to plug it in. It did the job but I decided I didn't want to add the extra clean up to my camping trip so I'm reselling it but it is a good product if you're keeping it in your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Gammie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Appliance
customer_reviews.text: I have had deep fryers below but this one is my favorite. Love the lid that keeps the grease from popping out. The inside can be removed for cleaning which is so helpful. My mother-in-law couldn't believe how easy it was to work and said it was much better than the more expensive ones that she had purchased. So I purchased one as her Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great smaller fryer!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first fryer, and it works great! I love that I can close the lid. When I made french fries, they had a bit more ice build-up than I would have liked so it was awesome to be able to save myself (and surrounding kitchen) from being peppered with hot oil. That fryer itself was super easy to setup and use. It doesn't have a massive basket, but we are a smaller family and it was perfect for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Don D

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spur of the moment, following a week of eating fair food and craving deep fried corn dogs. I tore open the box and immediately set out to make some deep fried goodness when I realized it takes A LOT OF OIL to fill up this baby, and the basket doesn't hold a lot of food. It also takes about 20 minutes to heat up the oil. I still use it about once a week, and I love it, but it could be better.
customer_reviews.author: K. H.

customer_reviews.title: Won't last
customer_reviews.text: Bought this deep fryer in December 2018. After a few uses the temperature markings started coming off. Within 3 months all the control markings were gone. Made due until today, January 10, 2020. It no longer works, has no power. Bought a Hamilton Beach because of the reputable name. Will think twice before buying anything from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Kemmerer

customer_reviews.title: Great Fryer
customer_reviews.text: I really like how fast it heats up the oil. It is so easy to take apart to clean. This a huge improvement over other fryers we've owned. I had one very similar to this a couple of years ago, but it was lost in our move. I tried out a simple fryer, but I hated it because it was impossible to get clean after each use. So I bought this fryer and absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Powers

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT THE FIRST TIME!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a deep fryer and I'm glad I purchased this one. I had a Cinco De Mayo party for 37 people and I made homemade taquitos. I typically fry them in a pan and they would always not be cooked evenly and it would take time. This fryer only took 1.5 minutes and they were done--compared to 3-4 minutes and all the spatter and mess that goes with a frying pan.
customer_reviews.author: Nine40e Corp

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with the design of this fryer in pretty much every aspect. Immersion heater coils and temperature sensors mean quick heating and accurate control. The lid comes off easily to clean (though maybe just a bit too easily), the coil and control assembly easily lifts out for cleaning, and the tank is easily removed as well. I love that the basket can be lowered and raised with the lid closed. Never another splash of hot oil. For the money, a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Willow

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: I knew this wouldn’t be easy to clean. But I leave the oil in it and keep lid closed after use. Only change the oil when it needs it. This is large enough to put in 4 regular chicken breasts. We make Keto fried chicken with it using pork rinds as the “breading”
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Suikii

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This fryer works great. Heats quickly, large basket and has lid to reduce splashing. My only con is the handle does not fold down and out of the way. This is important to me because I leave it out on the counter top and can get in the way. It can be removed but I have been to known to loose items that are not kept together.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy R. Mattern

customer_reviews.title: Handle is unreliable when full of hot food
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. The heating unit is exposed to the hot oil and is hard to clean. The handle for the basket fits poorly and collapses whenever you take it from the hot oil with hot food. Overall a disappointment. Should have stuck with the smaller but better made Cuisinart fryer.
customer_reviews.author: T Bara

customer_reviews.title: More research
customer_reviews.text: The grease actually goes directly in fryer over the heating element which in my opinion is not safe and will burn out quickly as mine did which I only had for one month and now it does not work. I am very disappointed and wouldn’t recommend for any one to purchase
customer_reviews.author: TraceeB

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: We love deep frying chicken for sweet and sour chicken or just your basic fries but we noticed over a period of time this unit leaks oil. It can be a lot. Besides that its easy to clean but if you put it back together just make sure its on tight or you might not get the light to come on to power it up. Its fast and easy but wished it didn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: OK But
customer_reviews.text: It works fine but the top is designed to come off for cleaning and it comes off too easily. The first time I used it I tried to reposition it on the counter and the cover came off in my hand. It was a bit tricky trying to put it back on with hot oil in it. I'm also not a fan of the new magnetic cords that come off if you look at them wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn R.

customer_reviews.title: Pain to use
customer_reviews.text: The lid is a pain. Make sure you have plenty of room to open it . If you are using it on your counter, it will hit the upper cabinets when it needs opening. Also, it sticks closed so you have to pry it open with your fingers. I have only used it once and will not use it again.
customer_reviews.author: cfcreate

customer_reviews.title: My second purchase!
customer_reviews.text: It is the second time I bought this product, the first time I was living in Puerto Rico and I really enjoyed using it a lot, due to Hurricane Maria I moved to the continental USA and left the fryer behind, now I am buying it again, really that I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo B. De Jesus Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Very bad fryer
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst fryer I've ever bought, the led got broken and as the button that opens the led from the first use, the oil smells very bad after the second use, the fryer got dangerously hot to touch , I had to through it in the garbage after few uses. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Rimatakriti

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deep fryer. It can cook more food at once than my older fryer. The cable seems more sturdy which I love. The temperature control is great! It makes it easier to tell when the oil is ready and easy to maintain the desired temperature. The food we have cooked in it so far has been delicious!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not good, I don’t recommend it
customer_reviews.text: This fryer has a major problem which is the plug-in that comes lose at the slightest movement. It’s the worse plug-in Connection I’ve ever seen. It also doesn’t shut tight on the sides as you can see in the photo so oil spells out.
customer_reviews.author: Imad Jarwan

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This unit is well thought out and works good. The only problem I have with mine is it never reaches a temp. higher than 155 degrees? It has stamped on it 175? It is easy to clean and the little window is a nice feature but it is hard to see good - steams up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pelissier

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is good. Price is very reasonable. Size is perfect for family of 3 or 4 people.
customer_reviews.text: Basket hangs too close to heating element could cause burn marks on the food being fried if not carefully watched and turned occasionally. View window on cover is pretty useless because it'll get clouded up very quickly by the water vapor or oil splashing up.
customer_reviews.author: Tan N. Vu

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only around 14 uses before breaking
customer_reviews.text: We only used this about once to twice a week for a couple months and then the open button broke, everything else works though, just can no longer open it. It was a good fryer until then. Not worth the investment if you want it around long.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Safety was my top priority
customer_reviews.text: Cooked chicken wings twice, onion rings once. I put fryer on back porch to cook and had the best wings and onion rings I’ve ever fried. After using, I waited for fryer to cool, unplugged and put old quilt over it since it’s cold outside.
customer_reviews.author: Lillidays

customer_reviews.title: It's not cool to the touch..
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this fryer, and so far it's living up to my expectations. Heats up the oil fairly quickly, and even after dropping in the food, doesn't take long to reach optimal temperature. But you do have to be careful: The outside get HOT... That's why I gave it four stars. Will update when it's used again if things change.
customer_reviews.author: JayE

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the kitchen clean
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it the lid keeps the splatter out of the kitchen. Heats up good. Fried food taste crisp
customer_reviews.author: John V.

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done, but had a funny smell.
customer_reviews.text: It works well, and it gets the job done. It seems to give off that 'new electronic/appliance odor' for too long though. We had used this 15+ times but it still gave off a strong new electronics smell whenever we used it. The smell got to me and my girlfriend too much and we've stopped using it. It certainly works, and fried food well. But once we kept noticing the smell it took away from anything we'd make or just using the product in general.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Bought to replace same model that was killed in a tragic accident.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an identical model that the wife decided to operate before checking to see if there was oil in it. The first one worked fine for about 2 years and I'm pretty sure I would have gotten many more years out of it. I think it says something as to how much I like this model since I went searching for the same one as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: A. Outlaw

customer_reviews.title: Not a single issue with this fryer
customer_reviews.text: This fryer is amazing! I love how it all comes apart and is super easy to clean. The lid and basket is probably the best feature. You can lift the food out of the oil with the lid closed! No need to worry about splattering! Temperature control is very accurate and it heats up so quick. Made perfect wings/ mozzarella sticks/ calamari, you name is. The cool touch sides are definitely an added bonus. Honestly way better than any other fryer I’ve had and I definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ketchup Kid

customer_reviews.title: A nice machine for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Little big but has very nice features. The basket works well, oil container removes easily for changing oil and cleaning. I especially like that you can close the lid with the basket up in a draining mode. Overall very happy. The outside stays pretty cool, ortley why it is larger I think. Wish it held just a bit more oil but is very manageable
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Counter top cooking for frying fish
customer_reviews.text: Excellent... Easy to use and worked like a charm the 1st time I used it... Ran the temp up to 340 to heat the grease.. Once it hit temp at 340, I pushed it up to +\- 350 for a couple minutes until the light turned green and dropped the battered fish in... Basket is super easy to use and cooks with the top closed. Easy cleanup.. much, much easier then frying fish in a pan on the oven.. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Moorman

customer_reviews.title: Go run and get this baby
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love! It’s easy to use, easy to clean, and fries with perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Michee

customer_reviews.title: Great home fryer and price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy I invested in this. Easy to use and clean. Impressed with design and price is great. Main reason for purchase is for homemade donuts, so I don’t use often. You can easily fry 4 at a time. Great to have the temperature controlled which is the main reason I finally purchased a deep fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Reeder

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Last
customer_reviews.text: I have used this maybe 20 times so far and it just stopped working on me after being very iffy the first few times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a zero if possible. I ordered the fryer, took it out of package, cooked in it one time and it doesn’t work anymore. Didn’t even finish frying what I was frying. Waste of money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Love French Fries
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing so much, it's a must. I love french fries and this product is great for entertaining guests. So quick and easy to heat up and takes plenty of oil for large sizes. Also, this thing is super easy to clean. It detaches so nicely and neatly. Love this purchase. I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Erici

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I can't rate the durability because I haven't had it very long. I bought two, one for me and one for my son for his birthday. I've used mine three times and he uses his constantly and says it's one of the best gifts he's ever gotten. It was easy to assemble and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Nice fryer but smaller than it looks
customer_reviews.text: Nice fryer. Cooks fast and even. Easy to clean. The only negative is it’s not as deep as it looks. Basket is only about 3 inches deep and not that big around. I can only fry 5-6 homemade chicken nuggets at time but still nice fryer. Not big tenders either. About 2”
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It really hold a lot. My only 2 complaints are that many things are fried at 350 degrees and it is not marked on the temp gauge and it is difficult to read the minimum and max lines for the oil. It is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Diane C

customer_reviews.title: What a great tabletop fryer
customer_reviews.text: What a great tabletop fryer. Used for the first time last night and cooked up breaded mushrooms, won tons, and egg rolls. I suggest using peanut oil as it has a low smoke point and the flavor is better. The capacity is bigger than you think, the safety features are awesome, and cleanup was super easy. Love the fact that you can see the food as it cooks and you don't have to open the lid to let the fryer basket drain.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm wish the window was a little bigger to view the food. I have no complains except I think the power cord should be longer. Glad i purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Lykebudda White

customer_reviews.title: Can handle heavy-duty use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for a food fundraiser, and it was used heavily for that to fry chicken tenders. It worked very well and could handle the large number of orders we had.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says
customer_reviews.text: It's a good fryer, built good. It's just it takes a lot of oil and doesn't submerge the basket enough. There is a lot of unused space that the basket can't reach and I feel like it could have been designed more efficiently to get the most out of the oil. I very rarely reuse oil so it can be a bit of a hindrance for me. Aside from that, its a great fryer!
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Thought I really needed this but just another big item that I don’t know where to put it. Thought about throwing it away. I will just use a pot like I was doing
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Calkins

customer_reviews.title: Wrong measurements
customer_reviews.text: Great little fryer. Works well with easy cleanup. I do have one complaint: The manual states that you should put in a minimum of 6 cups of oil and a maximum of 8 cups. I measured the min max markings on the inside of the pot with the element attached and the minimum is 8 cups and the maximum is 10 cups. This is a large discrepancy. Should I go by the markings or what the manual states?
customer_reviews.author: B. Kasper

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: There is no way this will hold food for two. It’s practically useless for meals. Hold four chicken wings tops and takes 10 plus mins to cook them. I’d be an hour cooking wings for two people with markup time included. Not so easy to clean either but not bad. The lid feature and basket are good but mostly it comes down to capacity. I’d never suggest it for meal prep and it takes up too much space as a snack maker.
customer_reviews.author: courtney ellrich

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with a filter.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and somewhat easy to operate. Safety cord disconnects easily and needs attention when plugging unit into the outlet. Does not have a grease filter in place like our old one did.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Mack

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: This deep fryer is just the right size for a household of two. The temperature control is not as accurate as I would like, the oil never reached the max temperature according to my stick thermometer but was hot enough to do the job. Cleanup was easy and mess free. For the price, it’s a fine deep fryer.
customer_reviews.author: TMc

customer_reviews.title: I Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Trying to do more at home to save money and making my own greasy food is a big one! I leave it in my garage so my kitchen doesn't have to eat all that grease.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Diller

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for a real fryer
customer_reviews.text: Okay, bought a real fryer instead of air fryer for son's southern gf. They love it for real frying! Size is perfect for them and he said it cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: It sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like this fryer at all. The max oil level is too low to fry croquettes and things like that in it. The element takes up a lot of space, and the basket is tiny. The unit is very big, the handle doesn’t fold down. The unit gets very hot to the touch. Giving it one more try, but I’m pretty sure it end up in the trash or at the Salvation Army. I used to have a Delongi deep fryer. Wish that one was still available, it was/ worked perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline J. Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Not the most amazing fryer, but will totally do the job for "normal" frying situations. I've done fries, chicken, tots, mozz sticks, etc. all fried really well. Only gripe is that the lid doesn't latch very well or tightly. Wish it worked a little better.
customer_reviews.author: jagerj

customer_reviews.title: Very small.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected. Much, MUCH smaller. Only reason I have two stars is because amazons customer service always does their best to make things right.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This fryer is about what you would expect for the price. It does its job, and it fits nicely on my counter. It does get very hot on the outside, and unless you are super duper careful, oil will leak.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Use it all the time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my boys. We use it all the time. It has a large basket and all the parts are removable for cleaning. I would caution you to make sure the lid is seated well when you put it back after cleaning, because it will pop off.
customer_reviews.author: kor

customer_reviews.title: It’s Dead Jim... ten uses and then nothing.
customer_reviews.text: It was great until it wasn’t. It was maybe it’s 10th use and part way through heating up it just stopped dead. Checked the cord was plugged in, checked the dial no lights, no temperature increase (checked with a thermometer). Plugged something else in to make sure the outlet had power and all was fine. No idea what happened but it’s dead Jim. I guess it would have been cheaper to go drive thru.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Tudhope

customer_reviews.title: Food Sticks to the Basket
customer_reviews.text: The reason I bought this product was to fry chicken and potatoes. While the temperature control and basket features are easy to use, the food sticks to the fry basket and you loose the crispy component. As a result, I would NOT recommend this frier.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Caple

customer_reviews.title: The lid does not snap shut easily. It pops open and I have to push ...
customer_reviews.text: It's flimsily built. The lid does not snap shut easily. It pops open and I have to push it a few times to get the lid to close. Plastic pieces don't line up perfectly, creating an uneven and sloppy surface. I would not buy it again. I would not recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: AMM

customer_reviews.title: ... using it for a year and it's still in good condition. The heating element is hard to clean ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a year and it's still in good condition. The heating element is hard to clean because it's attached and you have to be very careful while washing it. Other than that, it works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Solace

customer_reviews.title: Good value.. Makes good deep fried food
customer_reviews.text: I like using this and my wife loves it. Cleaning is easy as it can be disassembled. Temperature is consistent and close to the set temperature.
customer_reviews.author: charliex

customer_reviews.title: A real pain to clean
customer_reviews.text: Fried Fresh Lake perch in it as its first use. As large as the overall unit is it has a surprisingly small area to cook in. Got past that and the fish came out fried ok. Then the real hassle came when it was time to clean it. The cleaning process was so involved with disassembly and cleaning of individual parts and some areas seemingly impossible to clean that we just emptied the oil and packed up the entire thing and put it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: James K

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old fryer that I wore out. This one heats up very quickly and is really easy to use. I really like the fact that you close the lid before lowering the basket into the hot oil. No more splatters all over the counter and cupboards! It does use quite a bit of oil but the way it fries makes up for it. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but that is it.
customer_reviews.text: Slow to heat and does not regain temperature when items are placed into the oil. The oil temperature is inaccurate set at 375 and actual temperature was 330 degrees. The power cord is only two feet long, The basket capacity is limited good for only a single serving. French fries that should cook quickly took 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: It heats up very quickly (under ten minutes) and has a nice large basket
customer_reviews.text: This is a high-quality deep fryer; I use mine all the time. It heats up very quickly (under ten minutes) and has a nice large basket. It'd be nice if it were self-cleaning (as in, had a valve for emptying the oil) but honestly, you have to wait for the oil to cool off either way, so what's the point of spending all that extra money?
customer_reviews.author: Megary725

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Cool-Touch Deep Fryer, 8 Cups / 2 Liters Oil Capacity, Lid with View Window, Basket with Hooks, 1500 Watts, Electric, Black (35021)
product_meta.description: Hamilton Beach deep fryers are generously sized for greater versatility -- some even accommodating a whole chicken. What's more, you can fry crispy, mouth-watering foods without the mess you've come to expect. Food can be lowered into hot oil and lifted out while the lid is closed for splatter-free frying. Hamilton Beach deep fryers also feature adjustable heat and convenient timers. Hamilton Beach consumer deep fryers for the home are easy to clean and most models include a dishwasher-safe nonstick pot. The breakaway cord featured on most deep fryers makes storage easy too.
feature_bullets: Cool-touch sides: Protect from accidental burns if you touch the sides of the deep fryer during cooking process.
Fast frying & heat-up: Immersed heating element in this professional style deep fryer heats up oil and cooks food faster so there’s less wait time.
2 liter oil capacity: Professional style deep fryer for home use cooks up to 6 cups of French fries or chicken tenders.
Special lid design for fewer splatters: Cook with the lid on for less mess—you can even lift the basket out of the oil to drain it while the lid is still closed.
Easy cleanup: Deep fryer has removable lid, heating element, and enamel-coated oil tank to allow for easy cleanup.
Adjustable temperature with ready light: Take the guesswork out of frying—adjustable temperature from 265°f to 375°f and ready lights let you know when the oil is ready.
Viewing window: Avoid splatters while still monitoring cooking through the viewing window.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,628 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
